post.author: MNeMiC
post.body:
Hmm, well, to find the links to the good codec pages I've put them all on my page anyways, the links I mean.

And about audio, yes, that is a possibility, and I'm still thinking about it, I mean, the size would go up rather 'much', atleast some and so, but I think I'm gonna try some VT's with sounds and have like a poll.

Also, about the sounds, I'm gonna make a 'triggered explosion' Video Tutorial, that one will include triggering, particle effects and sounds

Might do it tonight since I've been away for 2 days.

Glad you liked it, it's not really hard to figure out and I'm sure it was out at the forums already.

Also, I kinda did this in a rush, I usually take more breaks to show where the mouse is and show 'important' locations.

post.author: MNeMiC
post.body:
okey, sure thing, but wait, whats a damage sector? haha, it's good to know what it is before i start trying to make it =/

I will add it to my tutorial list tho, but I have to add sounds to the ones I have before I start on any new ones, so perhaps this weekend one or two new might be here =)

post.author: Agent Spork
post.body: I think what he is referring to as a "damage sector" is basically a floor that does damage to you as you're standing on it. The term "damage sector" comes from the first 2 doom games.

post.author: abigserve
post.body:
Damge sector (trigr_hert):
1. A set region in which to damage a player and or character.
2. An immediate death region/area/spot.
3. A small underground fungus created by small insects called BugServs, originally discovered by an parapleigic hermit working out of a cave somewhere in the alps.
(See trigger_hurt)

Hope this helps
